item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 8, 2024 at 2:45 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Ham Radio 101: What is WSPR? (41 points | 9 comments)
2. Launch HN: Codebuff (YC F24) – CLI tool that writes code for you (205 points | 166 comments)
3. Functional ultrasound through the skull (128 points | 39 comments)
4. Using Ghidra and Python to reverse engineer Ecco the Dolphin (329 points | 77 comments)
5. Wild Ball (23 points | 9 comments)
6. Sustainable Web Interest Group Is Formed (119 points | 33 comments)
7. AI for real-time fusion plasma behavior prediction and manipulation (207 points | 105 comments)
8. Mushroom Color Atlas (169 points | 21 comments)
9. iPhones Mysteriously Rebooting Themselves, Locking Cops Out (49 points | 30 comments)
10. QNX is now free for anything non-commercial, plus there's an RPi image (448 points | 182 comments)
11. Show HN: BemiDB – Postgres read replica optimized for analytics (142 points | 67 comments)
12. Edge Scripting: Build and run applications at the edge (86 points | 34 comments)
13. Show HN: Draw.Audio – A musical sketchpad using the Web Audio API (47 points | 13 comments)
14. I'm not mutable, I'm partially instantiated (172 points | 59 comments)
15. Ambulance hits cyclist, rushes him to hospital, then sticks him with $1,800 bill (142 points | 115 comments)
16. Turing kicked us out of Heaven (2023) (10 points | 4 comments)
17. Hyperlight: Virtual machine-based security for functions at scale (74 points | 16 comments)
18. The Brothers Grimm: A Biography (39 points | 10 comments)
19. The egg or the chicken? An ancient unicellular says egg (48 points | 70 comments)
20. Perhaps Rust Needs "Defer" (56 points | 55 comments)
21. Imaging shapes of atomic nuclei in high-energy nuclear collisions (32 points | 3 comments)
22. Show HN: Directional antenna alignment using phone motion sensors (25 points | 6 comments)
23. How to send a photo around the world in 1926 (2013) (5 points | discuss)
24. Toronto crypto company CEO kidnapped, held for $1M ransom before being released (125 points | 92 comments)
25. Ultraprecise method of aligning 3D semiconductor chips invented (125 points | 15 comments)
26. Five minutes of exercise a day could lower blood pressure (83 points | 50 comments)
27. After decades, FDA moves to pull ineffective decongestant off shelves (3 points | discuss)
28. Linux Syscall Support (158 points | 97 comments)
29. Excerpts from a conversation about personal information management (144 points | 73 comments)
30. URAvatar: Universal Relightable Gaussian Codec Avatars (110 points | 13 comments)
